title: PWV Year in Review 2025
description: Highlights and touchpoints with founders, partners, and the PWV community across early 2025.

events.title: Cursor raises $105M Series B
events.description: Cursor announces $105M Series B from Thrive Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Benchmark, exceeding $100M in recurring revenue with millions of programmers using the AI code editor.

events.title: Landing More Customers: A PWV Founder Event
events.description: Join the Preston-Werner Ventures Founder Community for an In-Person Event Focused on GTM, Marketing, and Customer Acquisition Strategies to Land More Customers. Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. Why Attend? Get Insights You Can Use: Proven GTM and customer acquisition strategies from founders and leaders who've been there. Tackle Real Challenges: Case studies from PWV portfolio companies showcasing actionable solutions. Build Your Network: Meet potential collaborators, clients, and partners over drinks and bites. Featured speakers include: Tom Preston-Werner, Co-founder of GitHub, GP at PWV; Gorkem Yurtseven, Co-founder of Fal.ai ‚Äì Generative media platform for developers; Cory O'Daniel, CEO & Co-Founder of Massdriver ‚Äì DevOps Without the Red Tape; Simon Box, CEO of ReSim.ai, Plug-and-Play Testing for Robotics and AI; And More!

events.title: PWV Fund I Investor Gathering
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. We're bringing together a small group of investors, fund-of-funds (FoFs), and family office representatives for an informal gathering with Tom Preston-Werner, David Thyresson (DT), and David Price to discuss PWV Fund I. This is an opportunity to meet the PWV team and ask questions, learn more about Fund I and access the data room, and connect with others who are exploring the fund over thoughtful conversation and refreshments. This is a private, invitation-only event.

events.title: PWV Fund I Pre-Close Gathering
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. We're bringing together a small group of prospective LPs, family offices, and fund-of-funds (FoFs) for a private, invitation-only gathering with Tom Preston-Werner, David Thyresson (DT), and David Price before PWV Fund I's first close on Friday, April 18th. This is a final chance to spend time with the PWV team in an informal, high-value setting, ask any final questions about the fund and our investment approach, connect with other investors who are also considering participation, and align on next steps if you've been reviewing the data room. Agenda: 4:30 ‚Äì 5:30 PM | Drinks, Conversations & Connections - Kick off the evening over great drinks, light bites, and conversations with the PWV team and fellow investors. 5:30 ‚Äì 6:30 PM | The Inside Track on PWV Fund I - A deeper dive into PWV Fund I, our investment strategy, and what's ahead. We're on track for first close, and this will be one of the final opportunities to engage in person before allocations are set.

media.alt: PWV Fund I Pre-Close Gathering at 95 Cumberland St

events.title: Founder & Friends Happy Hour
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. Join an incredible group of founders at The Lighthouse in San Francisco for our Founder & Friends Happy Hour event! Why Attend? Ideas, intros, and opportunities: The right room leads to the right conversations‚Äîwhether it's a technical breakthrough, a new partner, or a potential client. Surprise guests: Founders and operators behind some of the most exciting companies often drop in, as well as other investors and good humans. Great food, drinks, people, and vibes: The PWV ecosystem is one of the best communities in venture and tech. Period. Spots are limited. RSVP now. We'd love to see you!

events.title: PWV Summer Session ‚Äì Founder Meetup
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. Connect. Contribute. Kick back (virtually). Join us for a relaxed Summer Meetup with fellow founders in the PWV portfolio, as well as General Partners, Tom Preston-Werner, DT, and David Price. Why come? Meet other incredible founders across the PWV community. Shape what we're building for you‚Äîfrom our Founder Directory to future programming (we want your input!). Share what you're building or need help with in small, casual breakouts. No demos or decks this time‚Äîjust good people, conversations, and meaningful connections. Hear about our new Fund's First Close! Whether you're heads-down or raising a round, this is an opportunity to step back, connect with people who get it, and help co-create what's next. Expect special guests to come through as always.

events.title: Founder Sessions: Join us in San Francisco
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. On September 25th, join us at The Light House in San Francisco for an evening with one of the best communities in venture and startups: our PWV Founders. We're digging into fundraising and what really matters in building and backing companies. The night kicks off with a conversation on where capital is heading and how the landscape is shifting for founders, featuring leading investors like Topher Conway (Managing Partner of SV Angel), Mary D'Onofrio, (Partner at Crosslink Capital, fmr Bessemer Venture Partners), and David Price (PWV General Partner). Next up, we're hosting a special Founder Sessions panel with Scott Johnston (ex-CEO of Docker), Johannes Landgraf, (Co-Founder & CEO of Ona, formerly Gitpod), and Tom Preston-Werner (Co-Founder of GitHub, PWV General Partner). To round out the evening, expect delectable libations and a family-style dinner fueling dynamic conversations, fresh perspectives, and the kind of connections that make incredible things happen.

events.title: PWV Fund I Q2 Update (Virtual)
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. This is a virtual event for both current and prospective PWV LPs. We'll cover: Fund Progress: Since our first close on May 28th, things have been busy! We'll catch you up. Investments & Pipeline: Updates on new investments (5) and upcoming opportunities. Strategic Priorities: Focus areas through end of year. Open Discussion. Why Attend: Stay informed on the most important fund updates. Share input and perspectives directly with the general partners. Align on strategy and next steps moving into the next quarter.

events.title: PWV Founder Meetup: The AI Capital Bubble: let's talk about it!
events.description: Hosted by Jennifer Tacheff, David Price & David Thyresson. Topic: The AI Capital Bubble. Let's talk about it! We're going to discuss the current state of Venture Capital investing + fundraising in the context of the (almost certain) "AI Bubble". We don't have all the answers, but we'll make progress by diving into questions as a group: What's going on? What is the felt experience? (ground truth). Should I care? (risks). Should I do anything differently? (strategy + tactics). Before the meetup, we'll start the conversation in the #pwv-founders channel on Slack. And we'll be adding some resources to read and listen to. It's going to be fun + important! We hope you'll join us. About PWV Monthly Virtual Meetups: Hosted by General Partners Tom, DT, and David, this is a monthly opportunity for all founders in the PWV Portfolio Company ecosystem. Why Attend: Meet and learn from other founders in our portfolio (read: the best community!). Hear from the PWV team who have built some of the biggest movements, products, and companies across industries. Plus, you never know who may swing by as a special guest.

Share input and perspectives directly with the general partners. Align on strategy and next steps moving into the next quarter.

events.title: Founder Sessions: How to Hire the Best Talent
events.description: Hosted by GPs Tom Preston-Werner, David Thyresson (DT), and David Price, featuring Martin Kess, Co-Founder & CTO of Purplefish. How to Hire the Best Talent with Martin Kess. Hiring is one of the most critical and challenging parts of building a company, especially in the early stages. In this hands-on workshop, Martin will walk founders through the full lifecycle of hiring: from sourcing and evaluating candidates to closing and retaining top talent. As the former Head of Engineering at Fractal Software, Martin built and ran the CTO vetting process, interviewing and assessing hundreds of founders and helping launch 145+ vertical SaaS startups in just over two years, each backed with $1M in pre-seed capital. Before that, he held engineering roles at Google, Amazon, Lyft, and Tudor, as well as several startups. Martin brings a rare blend of experience, having built technical teams from zero to scale across both startup and enterprise environments. Expect tactical insights, proven frameworks, and candid lessons learned from hundreds of hiring processes. Why Attend: Learn how to build and scale your team the right way, from sourcing to close. Get proven frameworks from someone who's vetted hundreds of founders, CTOs and engineers. Connect with other founders in the PWV ecosystem and hear directly from the PWV leadership team.

events.title: BOOST 6 Demo Day
events.location: Suffolk Construction National Headquarters, Boston, Massachusetts
events.description: Hosted by Suffolk Technologies. Join us for BOOST 6 Demo Day, the culminating event of Suffolk Technologies' premier built environment accelerator. This year's program brings together a dynamic cohort of startups solving some of the industry's most critical challenges across construction, design, real estate, and infrastructure. The afternoon will kick off with a keynote from Jeevan Kalanithi, founder and CEO of OpenSpace, who will share insights on scaling innovation in the built world. Following the keynote, the BOOST 6 companies will take the stage to pitch their cutting-edge solutions to an audience of industry leaders, investors, and potential customers. Following the pitches, dive into our startup showcase to connect with founders, explore hands-on demos, and engage with leaders shaping the future of the industry, then cap off the evening at our BOOST after-party, sponsored by Marsh McLennan and Baker Tilly! Don't miss this opportunity to experience the future of the built environment firsthand.

media.alt: BOOST 6 Demo Day at Suffolk Construction National Headquarters
media.caption: BOOST 6 Demo Day
